storyInfo: After escaping from the Confessarius, Shining, with Nightingale in tow, seeks shelter from the rain. The two of them have a good time playing with the homeowner's daughter. Shining dispatches the assassins that had been sent after them, and the two pass by Nearl as they prepare to leave after the rain stops.

attributes.content: Who's there?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Excuse me, we're just passing mercenaries. The rain's getting heavy, so we'd like to shelter here for a while. Would that be alright?
You can head on over to the village inn.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: We'll only be here until the rain clears up. We can't stay long anyway.
Anyone else with you?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Just my friend. She can't walk very well.
Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: We mean you no harm.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Your kind isn't welcome here, devil. Get lost.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: A longsword is pointed at her neck.
I'm not gonna repeat myself.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Then, please... at least allow my friend to rest here.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: What's her problem?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: The same as you, good sir.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Infected?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: You said you're a merc, yeah?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Stay right here by the door, and don't go wandering off.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Dad, do we have guests?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Nothing you need to worry about. Head back inside.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Ngh...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You're awake, Liz?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We were fortunate enough to find a place to rest. It won't be much longer until we're out of Victoria.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Thank goodness...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You make sure to get some rest too, alright?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Thank you. I'll do just that.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Ma'am, do you need a towel?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Thank you very much.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: From afar, the owner of the home watches his daughter approach the Sarkaz, and he reaches subconsciously for the hilt of his sword.
But what he'd feared did not come to pass.
Shining accepts the towel and helps Nightingale dry her hair. After painstakingly tending to her companion, she then wipes down her own long, dripping hair.
Did you need anything else?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: N-No, I was just thinking of something to say...
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Chirp, chirp.
A small blue creature pops out from Nightingale's pocket and lands on her shoulder.
Whoa, a fowlbeast!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Can I pet it?!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Nightingale raises her hand, and the fowlbeast hops from her shoulder to her fingertips.
I've never seen such an obedient fowlbeast before!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Heehee~ Hello there~
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Where are you from?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The fowlbeast chirps, as if replying to the girl's question.
Little fowlbeast, little fowlbeast, do you want to play a game?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: My dad made me a lot of toys, but the other kids in the village don't like playing with me.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Game? What kind of game?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Do you wanna play too, ma'am?! Give me a sec!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The girl hurries back into her room to search for something.
After rummaging around for a while, she comes back with a small cardboard box.
I have a lot of really fun stuff. My dad carved them all out of wood!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: My favorite is this one—
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Huh...
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The girl digs through the box, pulling out a wooden block or two every now and then.
Everything's fallen apart...
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Is there anything I can help you with?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Oh, yes, thanks.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Can you help me take all the blocks out? Then stack them up in groups of three. First horizontally, then vertically, and repeat.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining helps the child dig through the box and pick out all the wooden blocks.
Your horns are so beautiful! Are you an Elafia?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: No, I'm a Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Oh, that makes sense... You don't have those fluffy ear tufts.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: I heard you're gonna leave Victoria after this when I was in my room.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Is Victoria... bad?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: No, it's just...
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: This country isn't for us.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining picks up some of the wooden blocks she had dug out from the box and begins stacking them on top of one another.
After only a few layers, the colors before her eyes already seem to be coalescing into a kaleidoscopic blur.
It has been a long time since she's experienced an environment so replete with warmth. As she relaxes, drowsiness starts to wash over her.
Her thoughts spin through the air along with motes of light.
Shining can already see the light coming from the exit.
And behind her, piled high in the shadows, are the bodies of Confessarius guards.
She simply pats the person strapped to her back — and does not turn around.
Nightingale is still not fully awake, and subconsciously clings tight to Shining.
Hang in there a bit longer, Liz.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: There they are!
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard

attributes.content: We need to leave this place.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: ...Though to where, I couldn't say either.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: There may be no place for us in these lands.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: But at the very least...
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I refuse to leave you behind here.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: The daylight flashes by from within the cave, leaving its vestiges on the supporting pillars and rocks.
Before Shining emerges, a blue fowlbeast has already darted out, flying impatiently towards the sunlight.
That sound just now — did it come from over there?
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard A

attributes.content: That's where they fled to.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard B

attributes.content: I'll give chase. You report to the leader.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard B

attributes.content: What's going on?
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard A

attributes.content: The cave entrance is about to collapse! Retreat, now!
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard B

attributes.content: W-We won't make it in time—!!
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard A

attributes.content: Owwww!
A yelp suddenly snaps Shining back to reality.
The girl had accidentally knocked over the nearly-completed tower of wooden blocks, sending the pieces scattering everywhere.
You're not going to rest a little more?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I'll manage.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Ugh... Now I have to start all over again.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: There's nothing wrong with starting over.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Can I... help too this time?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Yeah, of course! The more the merrier!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: As the three of them start rebuilding the tower, Shining glances over at the owner of the house.
He is seated by the window, longsword still in hand.
Meanwhile, his child is sitting with the two women, pushing some of the fallen blocks in front of Nightingale before continuing to stack them up.
One more... to go... And, done!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: We can start playing the game now!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The rules are really easy. First, you roll the dice, then you pull out the same number of blocks from the tower and stack them on top. Whoever knocks it over loses!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Let's roll the dice to see who goes first.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The die bounces several times under their gaze before coming to a decision.
I'm going first then?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Yup!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Nightingale picks up the die and lets it roll off her palm.
She can't muster much strength, but it's okay since this is the first block.
You're up next, nice lady in black.
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Shining takes the die next and casts it.
She takes note of the number, and turns to the wooden tower.
While removing a block isn't inherently difficult, the tower will naturally start falling apart as the game progresses.
Past choices and occurrences accumulate, stacking up layer by layer, and applying ever more pressure on the future.
A sensation she finds disagreeable.
But rules are rules, and she must abide by them.
And so, another block is stacked on top.
Phew... How are you feeling, Liz?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Mm... No issues here...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: We're already quite far from the lab. It's not likely that they'd catch up to us at this point.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We still have a long way to go. Let's get some rest and have a bite to eat.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I'm not hungry yet...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Shining opens her bag and finds she has only one piece of fruit left.
We only have a bit of dry food left. Can you eat the fruit first?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: There should be a village just across the bridge where I can buy us some food.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Here, go ahead and eat. I've peeled it for you.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: As soon as they step into the village, they are surrounded by a constant chorus of surprised murmurs, as if they were beasts that had broken loose.
But Shining doesn't care about that. The Victorians won't see them again after they're done buying food.

attributes.name: Bread Vendor
attributes.content: Hello, can I help you...

attributes.name: Bread Vendor
attributes.content: D-Devils?!
Good day. I'd like to purchase some bread.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Away with you! I don't do business with devils!
attributes.name: Bread Vendor

attributes.content: Just name your price. I'll pay.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Hah. If I accepted your money, who'd still eat my bread?
attributes.name: Bread Vendor

attributes.content: Now scram. There are customers behind you.
attributes.name: Bread Vendor

attributes.content: My apologies.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining's hand presses into the hilt of her sword.
The morning light flashes by.
*sigh*...
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Eeeek!
attributes.name: Bread Vendor

attributes.content: M-Murderer!
attributes.name: Bread Vendor

attributes.content: Wait—
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining had long since noticed the Confessarius guards tailing her, so she had deliberately been avoiding crowded places to keep a low profile.
But as the bread stall owner runs towards the crowd, yelling and shrieking, more and more people start to gather.
'That devil's a murderer!'
'Someone get the police!'
'Isn't the village chief's son a caster? Hurry and get him over here!'
She only wanted to buy some food to fill her stomach, but she has no choice but to hastily flee the village in the end.
Her companion can only clutch fearfully at her robe, trembling uncontrollably.
And even further behind them, screams and curses continue for a long while.
Shining?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: When she focuses on the present again, the three of them had already been playing together for quite some time.
Several of the wooden tower levels are supported by only a single block, yet the rickety tower somehow still maintains an uneasy equilibrium.
It won't be long until a winner is decided.
Is there anything I can help you with?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I think... I can do this.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: The block she grabs is wedged so tightly that all blocks above it wobble every time Nightingale tries to move it.
Nightingale and the child continue staring intently at the block, neither noticing that Shining and the owner of the house have stood up at the same time.
I think I left my wallet outside.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Would you mind keeping an eye on my friend? I'll be right back.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: It's nothing. Let's continue.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: She tries again and again, hoping that the tower's center of gravity might change.
But the pressure exerted on that single block of wood does not let up.
What would Shining do? She ponders.
She remembers that Shining would draw out the blocks faster than the eye can see, without giving the tower even a chance to wobble.
She prepares to give it a try.
You can do it!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Nightingale takes a deep breath, grabs the wooden block, and forcefully pulls—
The morning light outside the window disappears in an instant as the tower collapses.
Yay! I win!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: For whatever reason, the young girl takes Nightingale's hand and starts dancing around, as if they had both won the game.
Her pure, genuine emotions send a ripple through Nightingale's stony heart.
You're back.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: I saw everything. One flick of your sword, and...
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Are you two on the run too?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Shining looks out the window. The rain gradually subsides, and the deepening darkness serves well to conceal the corpses.
Eight Confessarius guards, and six assassins of unknown origin. Two different groups had arrived at the same doorstep.
So, the other group of six—
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Came to kill my child.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Is that why you were willing to shelter us from the rain?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: It's because... you're Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: It was a race against time. And the guard I hired hasn't gotten here yet.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: You two are Sarkaz, and I know for a fact that that hoity-toity noble would never deign to hire one.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: You seemed capable, so I decided to hedge my bets. But I never thought you'd...
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: It's fine. I understand.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: In any case, you've done me a huge favor. If you're in no hurry to leave, feel free to stay the night.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Thank you, sir. We truly appreciate your kind offer, but unfortunately time is not on our side either.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: One sec.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: It'll be tough for you to buy food along the way, right? Here, I have some bread and jerky.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: This is... Thank you very much, sir.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I should be thanking you, Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: I haven't seen my daughter having this much fun with others in a long, long time.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: She's been like this since she was little. Never suspicious towards anyone.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: But we've always been on the run. Constantly moving, avoiding others. She hasn't had much of a chance to have normal interactions.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: But those days will soon be over. Once that merc shows up and takes her to live with her relatives, she'll finally be able to settle down.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: You're not going with her?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: That damn noble killed my wife and got me sick... Once my daughter's out of harm's way, I'm getting payback, one way or another.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: I won't run.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: The rain's stopped.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Once again, thank you for letting us stay. We must be on our way now.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Liz, it's time to go.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: It's already so late, though. Are you sure you don't want to stay the night?
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: I'm sorry. We'll come play with you again if we get the chance, okay?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Wait!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Here, this is for you!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The girl stuffs two rocks into Shining's hand.
What are these?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: They're two lucky rocks I found by the river!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Lucky... rocks?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Yeah! Just tap them together, and you'll be sure to have good luck!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: The last time I did it, Dad brought home a huge fowlbeast and we had a big feast!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: Maybe the next time you tap them, we'll be able to meet again!
attributes.name: Villager's Child

attributes.content: I hope that day comes as well.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Farewell, Sarkaz. Until we meet again.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Until we meet again.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: You're finally here?
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Hello, Mr. Edmund.
Thanks for coming all the way out here, Ms. Nearl. Please, come in.
attributes.name: Infected Villager

attributes.content: Liz.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: This lucky rock is for you.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Huh...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Were you happy?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: ...not sure I understand what that means.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: But, I did feel... very warm...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Being cared for, being appreciated...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Seeing someone offer a helping hand, and being able to hold it... instead of having a sword pointed at you.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: If we could always have opportunities like these... I'm sure... I'd be happy.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Can we try stopping by the village again, some other time?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz...
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Not everyone will treat us with kindness.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We're Sarkaz, and infected with Oripathy. Most in this land will not welcome us.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Had that homeowner not also been an Infected, we might not even have had the opportunity to rest beneath those eaves.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: But, there's always a chance, right?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Sometimes, we can relieve the suffering of others. So I believe that, sometimes, others can do the same for us.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Even if the likelihood is extremely slim?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I believe in you, Shining. Someone out there will recognize your sincerity, your earnestness.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: ...If you say so.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Whenever we pass by a village, I'll ask the villagers. Whenever I see a caravan, I'll ask the merchants.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: People will look down on us and ignore us. We must be prepared for that.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: But if luck is on our side, we may yet find selfless people willing to help us. And maybe, in the not-too-distant future, we may even find a place where we can finally rest our feet.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: But luck is already on our side.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Nightingale takes out the lucky rock Shining had given her.
Mm, that's right.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining also takes out hers.
The two rocks bump together, making a crisp, clean sound.
Beneath the moonlight, the two Sarkaz leave Victoria, blessed by luck.
